extracted_concepts.definition: A special bond required for a creature to use the magical properties of certain magic items, typically those of rare or greater rarity.

rule_logic.implication: The creature must first become attuned to the item.

extracted_concepts.definition: The procedure a creature must follow to become attuned to a magic item.

rule_logic.premise: A creature wishes to attune to a magic item
rule_logic.implication: The creature must spend a short rest focused on only that item. During this rest, the creature must be in physical contact with the item and learns its properties, how to use them, and whether it requires an action to use. The attunement ends if the creature dies, or if the item is more than 100 feet away for 24 hours.
exceptions: Some items have additional requirements for attunement, which are specified in their descriptions.
rule_logic.description_text: Attuning to a magic item requires a creature to spend a short rest focused on only that item. If the short rest is interrupted, the attunement attempt fails. Otherwise, at the end of the short rest, the creature gains an understanding of the item's properties and how to use them, as well as whether it requires an action to use. A creature can't be attuned to more than one copy of the same item. The attunement lasts until the creature dies, or until the item is more than 100 feet away from the creature for 24 hours. A creature can also voluntarily end attunement by spending another short rest focused on the item.

rule_logic.description_text: The attunement lasts until the creature dies, or until the item is more than 100 feet away from the creature for 24 hours. A creature can also voluntarily end attunement by spending another short rest focused on the item.

rule_logic.description_text: Attuning to an item requires a creature to spend a short rest focused on only that item while being in physical contact with it (this can't be the same short rest used to learn the item's properties).
